intro: Leopoldia constricta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms in the spring. Leopoldia constricta is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
